text: Draught at Alla Spinna, Philly, on April 30, 2016.Hazy to golden color, white head. Fresh, light acidic, apricots scent. Acidic, some brett, a tad sour, fresh taste. Brett, acidic aftertaste. Fizzy mouthfeel, low bitterness.

Draft. Small white head atop hazy apple juice body. Aroma is moderately sweet, herbal, sweat sock, some barnyard, cantaloupe, light lemon, wood. Taste is medium sweet, lemon, some barnyard, light funk. Light-medium body, light acidity.

On draft at Tired Hands Fermentaria. The pour is a darker golden yellow, slightly hazy, with a thick white head that falls to a film, leaving solid lace. The aroma is great. There is a lot of lemongrass and lemon zest right up front. Its tart and citrusy at first, then becomes a little earthy on the back end. No real malt presence, which I like. The flavor is tart and fruity up front. Not a juicy fruit, but a dry fruit flesh and skin. The light spice picks up and a soft juiciness carries it out the back end. The mouth feel is medium bodied, with a lovely brighter carbonation and a lingeringly fruity and earthy finish. This is excellent. Im happily surprised by this.

Flight at Tired Hands with koleminer20. Aroma is tart, citrus, lemongrass, sweet and nice. Appearance is golden, slight haze, white head. Taste is tart, dry, citrus, zest, grass, really nice. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, citrus and tart aftertaste. Overall, this is really really good.
Hazy golden color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of citrus, spices, rye, wood, lacto. Taste of citrus, earth, spices, rye, grape, tart finish.
1L growler shared by AirForceHops. Thanks, Chris! Aroma is wheat, orange, grass. Taste is crisp, wheat, honey, orange. White grape skin bitter and oak at the finish.

8 oz. sample at Tired Hands Fermentaria on 6/3/2016, plus took home a 32 oz. growler. Very hazy gold, thin head in the chalice. Aroma is mild oak, slight funk, straw and lemon rind 
The flavor has a nice mild lingering throughout the sip. Mild hints of floral tones and a light tart finish. Nice floral/ lemon/ barnyard balance. Light ABV with a huge amount of flavor.
On tap at the Fermentaria. Pours a hazy gold with small white head that lasts. The aroma is pepper and grass. Thin mouth, tart lemon, juicy, light finish, very good.
Growler. Yellow pour with white head. Herbal, floral, fruit and yeast aromas. Flavors are floral, yeast, fruit forward tones.
Growler - pours yellow white head- nose and taste of lemon, citrus, oak and French yeast - medium body

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey during the SAVOR Week 4 Hands / Against The Grain tap takeover. Shared by Kevin, thanks! Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of herbs, spices, light floral notes, some citrus. Tastes of slight tart acidic notes, citrus. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
Great balance. Citrus and some hay. Nice hop presence. Element of passionfruit. Hazy yellow pour with good head and lacing. Very easy drinking. Tangy finish. Tap at Churchkey.

Draught sample at Omnipollos Hatt.
Hazy pale yellow, short white head.
Sour aroma with lemons, white pepper and hay.
Flavour follows suite. Dry and quite sour. 
Light bodied, soft tickling carbonation.
Super lemony. A hint of pepper. Little head, straw, hazy. The lemon zest funk puts it over the top.
Pours hazy apple juice with a medium frothy white head. Aromas of citrus, farmhouse, funk, gooseberry. Taste is fruity and floral with light funk. Mouthfeel is light bodied with medium carbonation.

Draft. Semi-hazy yellow with one finger white head. Tart aroma with citrus, light funk, hay and slight earthy notes. Taste is also somewhat tart with citrus, hay, funk, earthiness, slight barnyard, herbal spiciness and a nice acidic touch in the finish. Medium, dry mouthfeel, light carbonation and dry and citric aftertaste with some acidity.
Tap. Hazy light gold. Oaky, slight sour hay, some spices, floral aromas. Sour, woody, white wine, but more muted than aroma. And thankfully missing any spice notes. Light chalky body.
Very refreshing mix of brett, kettle sour, fruity character, bit wheaty. Delicious, very drinkable. Absolutely biere de garde character, though, not sure what that is about.

Draft at Churchkey. Really not much need to upload a pic, although I dud, because this looks like almost every other Tired Hands beer. Aroma of lemony raw bread dough. Taste has citrus, straw, subtle tannins. Low abv for the style, but tasty enough.

Draft at the Fermentaria with Vi, Thi and Ken. Pours a hazy golden body with thick white lacing. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with noticeable carbonation and with notes of soft tart stone fruits, lemons, tart oak, soft minerality and gentle grains.

Hazy golden body, medium sized white head, soapy lacing. Lemon, mineral water, Emptiness fruity tart notes, must, oak, some spicy grains, grass, and bread. Medium bodied, with lively tartness, and smooth carbonation.
From tap. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma is mild spiced, citrusy and sourish. Smooth fruity, wineous. Light grapes. Mild estery. Smooth fruity and light citric far finish.
On tap at TJs. Poured a hazy golden color with a smaller sized head. Citrus, woody oakiness, vanilla, citrus, and a tart funky finish.
Pours a hazy gold with a thick white head. Aroma of oak, funk, citrus and malt. Taste follows with some tart lemon zest notes. Very nice.

Glass at the Ferm, pours ultra hazy orange with large white head that was somewhat lasting. Smell is a touch metallic and acidic fruit forward but that blew off somewhat with a little bit of time. The Taste is emptiness funk, light vinegar, pepper, lemon rind, wet wheat and vitamin minerals in the finish. Medium bodied. More of a sour saison or wild ale in flavor profile, not a whole lot of Biere de garde aspects which Im fine with. Interesting beer
